task_summary: The robot arm pours contents into a mug located on the workspace.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a single robotic manipulator (SARA) stationed at a tabletop. The objective is to pour the contents from the end-effector, acting as a 'source', into a visible mug placed on the workspace. The system is expected to perceive the mug, move above it precisely, execute a controlled pour (with a visible 90° tilt), and retreat smoothly. Constraints include clear visibility of the mug and collision avoidance with the environment.
preconditions: Mug is placed upright and visible on the workspace.
Robot holds the source object with pourable content.
Workspace is clear of obstacles between robot and mug.
stepwise_plan: Verify or detect the mug’s position.
Move above the mug to a pre-defined offset.
Pour contents into the mug with a controlled 90° tilt.
Retract the arm from the mug after pouring.
success_criteria: Robot accurately moves to above the mug.
Contents are poured into the mug with no spillage.
Robot retreats safely after pouring is complete.
failure_and_recovery: Mug not detected: Attempt mug detection up to one time.
Pour misalignment: None detected, as alignment phase is visually confirmed.
Spillage: No direct monitoring, must rely on accurate movement.
task_long_description.termination: Sequence completes once the robot retreats after the pour. Task ends if any action fails irrecoverably.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Check if the mug is visible to the perception system.
Run mug detection if visibility condition fails.
Move end-effector above the mug by 10cm.
Pour from the source gripper into the mug at a 90° tilt with normal rate.
Retract arm from the mug after pouring.

failure_modes: Robot collision with mug or workspace
recovery_strategy: Retry mug detection if not initially visible
Abort if position cannot be found
Stop if critical error in pour or retreat
assumptions: Instruction does not specify a source; assumed 'gripper' as source based on frames (robot never grasps a bottle/container visible, only gripper moves and tilts)
No explicit adjustment or monitoring of poured amount in available actions/frames, so 'amount' set to null
Pour action interpreted with 90° tilt per visual observation (frames 3-5)
Approach and retreat are necessary for safe operation though not specified in instruction

expected_success_criteria: Robot moves to a position above the mug
Pour motion is completed with gripper oriented above mug
Robot moves away from mug after pour
